{{Infobox book | name = The Oxford Companion to Beer | image = Garrett-ocb-cover.jpg | caption = U.S. first edition cover | author = [[Garrett Oliver]] (editor) | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | subject = [[Beer]] | publisher = [[Oxford University Press]] | release_date = October 2011
(first edition) | media_type = Print ([[hardcover]]) | pages = 920 | isbn = 978-0-19-536713-3 | dewey= 641.2'3–dc23 | congress= TP570.O95 }} '''''The Oxford Companion to Beer''''', abbreviated '''''OCB''''', is a book in the [[Book series|series]] of [[Oxford Companions]] published by [[Oxford University Press]]. The book provides an alphabetically arranged reference to [[beer]], compiled and edited by [[Garrett Oliver]] with a foreword by U.S. chef [[Tom Colicchio]]. Published in 2011, the work draws on 166 contributors from 24 countries to amass over 1,100 entries on beer.Martineau, Chantal, ''The Village Voice'' (September 23, 2011). [http://blogs.villagevoice.com/forkintheroad/2011/09/brooklyn_brewer_1.php Brooklyn Brewery's Garrett Oliver On The Oxford Companion to Beer] [[Eric Asimov]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' described the work as a "mammoth undertaking ... encyclopedic in scope", and that the editor has "captured the blossoming of a global beer culture at a thriving moment".{{Cite web|last =Asimov |first =Eric ''The New York Times'' |title = Where to Look Up Dry-Hopping and Decoction |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/21/dining/reviews/the-ultimate-beer-guide-the-pour.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 |date =September 20, 2011}} Critical opinion of the work has also been voiced, with contentions that the ''OCB'' perpetuates certain beer history myths,{{Cite web|last=Hawkes | first=Will, ''The Independent'' |title= Good brews bible: The Oxford Companion to Beer encourages people to take ales more seriously | url= https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/food-and-drink/features/good-brews-bible-the-oxford-companion-to-beer-encourages-people-to-take-ales-more-seriously-6264014.html |date= November 18, 2011 }} and other omissions published by writers and beer enthusiasts,{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/all-we-can-eat/post/oxford-companion-to-beer-not-infallible/2011/10/29/gIQAgPGvSM_blog.html|title=Oxford Companion to Beer not infallible|last=Kitsock|first=Greg|date=October 31, 2011|website=[[Washington Post]]|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-05-28}} some of whom ''OCB'' contributors themselves.Risen, Clay, ''The Atlantic'' (October 31, 2011). [https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2011/10/the-problem-with-guides-to-beer-drinking-there-just-arent-enough/247367/ The Problem With Guides to Beer Drinking: There Just Aren't Enough] Shortly after publication an unofficial [[wiki|wiki site]] was launched to "make comments, add annotation, identify errata and suggest further sources to the text of ''The Oxford Companion to Beer''".[http://beerblog.genx40.com/article/ocbcommentary1/ OCBeerCommentary Wiki archived at A Good Beer Blog] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://global.oup.com/academic/product/the-oxford-companion-to-beer-9780195367133?q=oxford%20companion%20to%20beer&lang=en&cc=no OUP U.S.] and [http://ukcatalogue.oup.com/product/9780195367133.do#.UfDLTIUXttQ OUP UK] ''The Oxford Companion to Beer'' information {{DEFAULTSORT:Oxford Companion To Beer}} [[Category:2011 books]] [[Category:Oxford University Press reference books]]

{{Infobox company |name = Vastari |image = |caption = |location = [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] |website = [http://www.vastari.com/ www.vastari.com] }}
'''Vastari''' is an online service provider that connects museums, exhibition producers, venues, collectors and suppliers for more efficient exhibitions. Vastari's headquarters are in [[London]], [[England]], with regional representatives in several countries around the world.<ref>Marchesoni, Maria Adelaide (2 June 2014) [http://www.arteconomy24.ilsole24ore.com/art/cultura-tempo-libero/2014-06-02/vastari-nuovo-link-collegare-174121.php Vastari: un nuovo link per collegare collezionisti e musei], ''[[Il Sole]]''. Retrieved 29 June 2014.</ref>
==Services== Vastari allows private collectors to upload their objects to a secure [[online database]] and remain anonymous. Registered and verified museums have access to search through the database for works relevant to future exhibitions.<ref>[http://artdaily.com/news/65212/Vastari-com--New-service-connecting-collectors-with-curators-online-launches#.U853i4BdXBc Vastari New Service Connecting Collectors with Curators Online Launches] ''ArtDaily''. Retrieved 2 July 2014</ref>
Art owners can share their art with curators who will research their collections and put the works into art historical context.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Collections Trust - Curators Gain Unprecedented Access to Works in Private Collections {{!}} Collections Trust|url = http://www.collectionstrust.org.uk/blog/item/1835-curators-gain-unprecedented-access-to-works-in-private-collections|website = [[Collections Trust]] |access-date = 2016-02-09|language = en-gb}}</ref> "The system includes two search engines: one database of exhibition proposals for collectors to browse and a search engine of objects for museums to consider for exhibition." <ref>Ardia, Mai (21 February 2014) [http://artradarjournal.com/2014/02/21/how-the-internet-is-changing-art-business-6-exciting-start-ups/ How the Internet is Changing the Art Business: 6 Exciting Start Ups], ''Art Radar''. Retrieved 20 May 2014</ref>
Vastari has also built the Touring Exhibition platform VTEN, where museums can list and exchange exhibitions with other institutional and private venues around the world.
Currently,{{when|date=August 2017}} Vastari has access to over 400,000 works, and has around 900 museums registered.<ref>L.S. (30 Jun 2014) [http://www.lastampa.it/2013/07/30/cultura/arte/il-progetto-vastari-exhibition-connection-sbarca-in-italia-tmzyH0YVMQx98lL6FuSnoJ/pagina.html Il progetto Vastari Exhibition Connection sbarca in Italia], ''[[La Stampa]]''. Retrieved 3 July 2014</ref>
Judged by leading technology companies such as [[Uber (company)|Uber]], [[Google]], and [[Virgin StartUp]],<ref>[https://www.virginstartup.org/ Virgin StartUp].</ref> Vastari was included in the 2017 Disrupt 100 list, an annual [[Tällt Ventures]] publication presenting businesses with the most potential to influence, change, or create new global markets.<ref>[http://www.disrupt100.com/ Disrupt 100].</ref>
==Funding== Vastari is a privately funded company. They completed the [[Microsoft Ventures Accelerator Programme]].<ref>[http://www.microsoft.com/bizspark/accelerator/ Microsoft Ventures Accelerator Programme], ''[[Microsoft]]''.</ref><ref>Savvas, Antony (13 December 2013) [https://www.forbes.com/sites/antonysavvas/2013/12/13/microsoft-expands-global-startup-accelerator-programme-in-the-uk/ Microsoft Expands Global Startup Accelerator Program In The UK], ''[[Forbes]]''. Retrieved 4 May 2014.</ref> On 5 February 2016, the company announced a major fundraising round from private investors in the tech and art space.<ref>{{Cite web| title = Vastari Group completes significant seed funding round | url = http://artdaily.com/news/84921/Vastari-Group-completes-significant-seed-funding-round-#.VrnfoFiLSR8|website = artdaily.com| publisher=ArtDaily | access-date = 2016-02-09 | first = Ignacio | last = Villarreal}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.vastari.com/ Official website]
[[Category:Companies with year of establishment missing]] [[Category:Companies based in the London Borough of Hackney]] [[Category:Internet companies of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Museum companies]] [[Category:Online catalogues]] [[Category:Online databases]]
{{company-stub}} {{Online-database-stub}}

'''Wine Collector 300''' is a [[wine]] collection and management package from [[IntelliScanner Corporation]]. Wine Collector was released in December 2004. Wine Collector uses the [[Universal Product Code|UPC]] [[barcode]] found on wine bottles to look up information on wines from an Internet-enabled database containing approximately 67,000 wine records, according to the company. Data can also be imported into the application from [[Tab delimited|tab-delimited]] text files. Wine label art work and tasting notes can be added for wines in the database. Inventory lists can be exported and printed.
==Specifications== Wine Collector is sold as a bundle of [[software]] and [[computer hardware|hardware]] with a portable [[IntelliScanner mini]] barcode reader. The same wine software is also included as part of the IntelliScanner Corporation's [[IntelliScanner mini bundle]] which also includes other software for organizing media, groceries, and other home assets. Wine Collector is available for both [[macOS|Mac OS X]] and [[Microsoft Windows]].
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *Biggs, John. [https://www.nytimes.com/2005/10/27/technology/circuits/27scanner.html?ei=5088&en=60b2088d75236128&ex=1288065600&adxnnl=1&partner=rssnyt&emc=rss&adxnnlx=1149865253-sY5zIUk3aGYTSlY5ettpzw/ IntelliScanner Wine Collector] in ''[[The New York Times]]'', October 27, 2005. *Weeks, David. [http://www.mymac.com/showarticle.php?id=2027 Wine Collector 1.0] in ''MyMac.com'', Wednesday, June 15, 2005
